choices.answer: A university founded to help aspiring politicians
A group of people who formally elect the president
A group of academics that report to the government
Government entity created in the Declaration of Independence
You need 538 electoral votes to become president.
We have had 538 presidents.
It is the total number of electoral votes. 435+100+3
This is the total number of representatives in the House.

questions.question: How are the number of electoral votes divided up?

choices.answer: A lottery that is held every 10 years.
The current president decides.
By state population.
It is based on the number of voters from the last election.

questions.question: If a candidate wins a state's popular vote you get:

choices.answer: All the electoral votes.
All the money!
Electoral votes based on the percentage of the popular vote.
The promise that this is your party's safe state.

questions.question: True of False: You can receive the most votes in an election and still lose.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: According to this movie, why do some people think the electoral college is unfair?

choices.answer: They want every vote to be counted.
Everyone should be able to vote, even children.
Candidates sometimes lie when discussing the issues.
They think it gives an unfair advantage to large states.

questions.question: Why do some think the electoral college is good for small states?

choices.answer: Candidates cannot completely ignore small states.
It was written in the Constitution.
Every states gets electoral votes.
They work together.
A state that specializes in creating playground equipment.
A state that is given more electoral votes after a census.
States that don't always vote for the same political party.
States that hold the elections at schools.
